title: Miridius quadrivirgatus
text: Miridius quadrivirgatus, is a species of <a href="bug%20%28insect%29">bug</a> from the <a href="Miridae">Miridae</a> family which can be found in <a href="Suffolk">Suffolk</a> and <a href="Pembrokeshire">Pembrokeshire</a> provinces of the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a>. The species is long and have creamy-red coloured stripes which go along its head, <a href="prothorax">prothorax</a> and <a href="Scutellum%20%28insect%20anatomy%29">scutellum</a>.
